text:
I'm having the same issues and have tried pretty much everything but the options still won't show. At first it wasn't working on Chrome so I switched to firefox then after a while it automatically stopped working there too so then I moved to Edge then about a week later it stopped working there also. Can't see Section, column options at all. It is not extensions related as deleted all extensions from firefox and did a fresh install but still no luck. The options seem to be showing for the rest of my team on both mac and windows, and all the browsers I'm trying to work on.

What is weirder is that it seems to work on specific themes only. I thought maybe we were doing something wrong in the theme setup, but the pre existing HubSpot themes on the portals have the same issue. The issue is becoming extremely frustrating as now I'm unable to properly edit pages on any browser.
to clarify these column and sections are the ones not showing. The one where they are showing is from a team mate and the one where it's not showing is from screen
I’ve run into this before <@U01AZBWH71U>. I could get it to work when I resized the browser window after page load
Thanks John. Just tried too, still doesn't work :slightly_frowning_face:
dang, sorry man. Did support say anything?
not yet, have emailed them. Will see if they are able to find a resolution. I'll post here if they find anything.
thanks. I am curious if scripts are firing too late or something. Can’t wait to hear what they find

:wave: I’d probably be the one to look into this, and slack is faster than support, the latest thought is:
• Some font your using in your css maybe conflicting with something in the editor (which we think happens if we can reproduce it too)
• Some font setting on your _system_ that is causing it not to load (which we think happens if we _can’t_ reproduce it)

Thanks Brian but the issue is happening on the HubSpot themes also. I created this page on the Education theme which uses the Raleway font, still doesn't work. I even deleted the font from my system to see if that does anything. Also checked Windows Language settings to see if there might be something there but all options are set to default.

i’m grasping at straws here, but it looks like your `Last saved a few seconds ago`  text looks, different? I wonder if it’s a slightly different font? Can you inspect element on the Edit Page text and see what the font value is? <https://p191.p3.n0.cdn.getcloudapp.com/items/5zuYdAbj/9aaa9cc6-ae85-4c07-9735-32d16f388ab9.jpg?v=bfbcde51c5cd9d2b4c7de899cc4fe973>
the way I can reproduce this is if I block all of HubSpots custom “Avenir” fonts from loading. I end up with no toolbars, and my autosave text looks similar to yours
I did inspect it and it is showing the Avenir Next font
did it on last saved also and showing avenir next there too

when I go to edit a page on this theme - <https://www.choosegulfcoast.com/>, the options for section and columns are showing on Chrome and Edge but don't show on Firefox. When I try to edit the test page in the screenshot from the education theme on all 3 browsers the options are not showing.

<https://www.charlestonpc.com/>
The options are showing on firefox for this theme but don't show on chrome or edge
